Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the 7-step plan by stating that it will create exactly 700,000 jobs in 7 years without providing sufficient evidence or support for this number.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the assertion that the 7-step plan will create 700,000 jobs in 7 years.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that implementing the 7-step plan will automatically lead to the creation of 700,000 jobs without considering alternative factors or potential obstacles.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for job creation or acknowledge other economic plans proposed by other candidates running for governor.
